alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:01PM CDT until May 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At New Ulm affecting Brown, Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin affecting Anoka and Hennepin Counties. Mississippi River at St. Cloud affecting Sherburne, Stearns and Wright Counties. Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Sauk River at St. Cloud affecting Stearns County. Snake River At Mora affecting Kanabec County. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. For the Cottonwood River...including Springfield, New Ulm...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Minnesota River...including Montevideo, Dawson, Granite Falls HWY 212, Morton, New Ulm, Mankato, Henderson MN19, Jordan, Savage...Major flooding is forecast. For the Sauk River...including St. Cloud...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Mississippi River...including Royalton 4NW, St. Cloud, Hwy 169 at Champlin, Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk, Fridley abv 37th Ave NE, St. Paul, Hastings L/D 2, Red Wing L/D 3, Red Wing...Minor flooding is forecast. For the REDWOOD RIVER...including Redwood Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Hwy 169 at Champlin. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Champlin - flooding begins on West River Parkway upstream from gage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 830 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 12.4 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 04/29/2001. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
